parts.name: Mouth
parts.intro: This is a diagram of the digestive system.
parts.explanation: The mouth is where food enters your body. Your teeth chew the food into smaller pieces, and your tongue helps move it around.

parts.name: Oesophagus
parts.explanation: The oesophagus is a long tube that carries food from your mouth down to your stomach. When you swallow, muscles push the food down this tube.

parts.name: Stomach
parts.explanation: The stomach is like a bag that holds your food. It squeezes and mixes the food with special juices that help break it down into smaller pieces.

parts.name: Colon
parts.explanation: The colon is a large tube that takes water from the leftover food. It helps turn the food into waste that your body needs to get rid of.

parts.name: Rectum
parts.explanation: The rectum is the last part of the digestive system. It stores the waste until your body is ready to get rid of it.

parts.name: Liver
parts.explanation: The liver is a large organ that helps clean your blood and makes a special juice called bile that helps digest your food.

parts.name: Pancreas
parts.explanation: The pancreas makes special chemicals called enzymes that help break down food in your small intestine so your body can use the nutrients.

parts.name: Small Intestine
parts.explanation: The small intestine is a long, winding tube where most of the nutrients from your food are absorbed into your blood to give you energy and help you grow.
